main event: On March 1, 1952, the crew of a C-54 troop carrier sighted an unidentified flying object over the Sea of Japan.
interesting points: The C-54 was flying at an altitude of 11,500 feet and turning to 300 degrees when the object was observed., The object was described as oval-shaped and bright orange in color with a 50-foot trail., The sighting lasted until the object gradually faded from view., The pilot and crew were captivated by the sighting and almost forgot to land the aircraft., The crew confirmed that the object was definitely not a jet aircraft.
witness description: Pilot Lt. E.J. Weed and two crew members, 2D Lt. T.G. Camidge and 2Lt. R.L. Archibald
